00287 
00290 /************************************************************************************
00291 The blob analysis is the post processing of connected component labeling (CC labeling).
00292 The connected component labeling identifies blobs in a image. The blob analysis calculates
00293 the detailed parameters of each blob such as perimeter, minimal enclosed rectangle and
00294 minimal enclosed circle. The blob analysis depends on three types of output of CC labeling:
00295 The ccmap, the global interval image and the blob list. The global interval image is a
00296 internal result of CC labeling. Please refer to the example below for detailed information.
00297 
00298 The steps to perform blob analysis are:
00299         Functionality                                           | API
00300 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00301 for the whole image                                             |
00302 [1] Connected component labeling(see Note1)                     | VLIB_createConnectedComponentsList & VLIB_createCCMap16Bit
00303 [2] Create blob list by extracting the internal                 | VLIB_createBlobList
00304     information of CCL                                          |
00305 [3] Allocate the scratch buffer. The buffer size depends        | VLIB_getblobIIBufSize & malloc
00306     on the maximal blob size of the image. These parameters     |
00307     are counted during blob list creation                       |
00308 for each blob                                                   |
00309 {                                                               |
00310     [4] Create the interval image of the blob                   | VLIB_createBlobIntervalImg
00311     [5] Calculate the perimeter of the blob                     | VLIB_calcBlobPerimeter
00312     [6] Calculate the minimal enclosed polygon of the blob      | VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedPolygon
00313     [7] Calculate the minimal enclosed rectangle of the blob    | VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedRect
00314     [8] Calculate the minimal enclosed circle of the blob       | VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedCircle
00315 }
00316 step [5],[6],[7],[8] are optional depends on the application
00317 The dependency between modules are:
00318     [2] depends on [1] for globlal interval image and the blob list (before blob list creation)
00319     [3] depends on [2] for maximal blob parameters
00320     [4] depends on [1,2,3] for globlal interval image, blob parameter and output buffer
00321     [5] depends on [1,4] for ccmap and blob interval image
00322     [6] depends on [3,4] for scratch buffer and blob interval image
00323     [7] depends on [6] for vertex point list of minimal enclosed polygon
00324     [8] depends on [6] for vertex point list of minimal enclosed polygon
00325 
00326 =============================================== Benchmark unit is(ms) ======================================================
00327 test case  num of blobs,  for createBlobList, make interval image, perimeter, polygon, minRectan, minCircle
00328    1          7 blobs,           0.01,                0.01,        0.00,       0.01,     0.04,     0.02
00329    2         47 blobs,           0.16,                0.16,        0.65,       0.27,     0.44,     0.20
00330    3         80 blobs,           0.13,                0.25,        0.26,       0.27,     0.80,     0.30
00331    4         41 blobs,           0.06,                0.06,        0.15,       0.11,     0.41,     0.18
00332    5          5 blobs,           0.09,                0.06,        0.36,       0.12,     0.07,     0.03
00333 ************************************************************************************/
